news.title: No property tax notice for now, says Ghaziabad civic body, councillors end protest
news.para: Ghaziabad councillors have ended their protest after the municipal commissioner pledged to halt inflated, auto-generated property tax bills. A 20% rebate on property tax is now available until September 30. The dispute centered on withheld minutes from a June 30 board meeting, which officials have now agreed to submit.

news.title: Bengaluru civic body's e-Khata system exposes widespread property tax evasion
news.para: Documents submitted by property owners help verify true extent and usage of each property and enable civic body to cross-check for under-reported dimensions and misclassified tax types, says BBMP official

news.title: Rajasthan township policy aims at affordable housing, green development: CM
news.para: Rajasthan's new Township Policy 2024 aims to create green, inclusive, and growth-oriented urban ecosystems. It mandates green spaces, rainwater harvesting, and affordable housing, while requiring industrial projects to reserve land for labour housing. The policy promotes vertical development, mixed land-use, and renewable energy, ensuring developer accountability and improved urban mobility through sector roads.

news.title: Lucknow development body to sell 200 vacant residential plots through e-auction
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority will auction around 200 residential plots. These plots are in Basant Kunj, Priyadarshani Colony, Gomtinagar and Kanpur Road scheme. The plots range from 60 sqmt to 252 sqmt. LDA has published the list on its website. The e-auction is open to all eligible applicants. Registration is a must for bidding.

news.title: Unified RERA portal likely by March-end to help track developers and projects
news.para: The Union housing ministry and AIFORERA are collaborating to launch a unified RERA portal by March, streamlining access to real estate project information across India. This centralized platform will standardize data from all state RERA websites, enhancing transparency for homebuyers.

news.title: DLF exits ₹10,000-crore South Mumbai project through settlement with Hubtown
news.para: Hubtown and DLF have resolved their long-standing dispute over the Rs 10,000 crore Tulsiwadi redevelopment project in south Mumbai. DLF has exited the project after receiving Rs 800 crore from Hubtown, ending years of litigation. Hubtown has mortgaged space in the project to secure the remaining payment, paving the way for project execution.

news.title: Delhi: MCD holds 2,333 property tax camps to help citizens avail amnesty scheme benefits
news.para: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi has conducted 2,333 property tax camps across its zones, resulting in a collection of Rs 145.19 crore from over 59,411 taxpayers. The SUNIYO scheme offers a full waiver on arrears for periods before 2020-21 if principal tax is paid. The deadline for a 10% rebate on lump sum payments has been extended to July 31.

news.title: PNB Housing Finance's net profit rises 23% to ₹534 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: PNB Housing Finance witnessed a notable surge in profitability, reporting a 23% increase in net profit, reaching Rs 534 crore for the quarter ended June 2025. The company's total income also experienced growth, climbing to Rs 2,082 crore, driven by higher interest income and improved net interest margins.

news.title: Brigade Group acquires 20.19 acre land parcel in Bengaluru for ₹588.33 crore
news.para: Brigade Group has expanded its portfolio. The company has acquired a 20.19-acre land parcel in Bengaluru's Whitefield-Hoskote corridor. The purchase was made through Ananthay Properties. The deal was valued at ₹588.33 crore.

news.title: Oberoi Realty's profit falls 28% in Q1 FY26 to ₹421 crore
news.para: Oberoi Realty Ltd experienced a 28% decrease in consolidated net profit, reaching Rs 421.25 crore for the quarter ending in June, attributed to reduced income. Despite this, the company reported property sales of Rs 1,639 crore during the same period and announced an interim dividend of Rs 2 per equity share for FY25-26.

news.title: Asking prices of properties in UK fall in July: Rightmove
news.para: Rightmove reported a significant 1.2% drop in asking prices for newly listed UK properties in July, marking the largest June-to-July decrease in over two decades. This decline is attributed to a surge in available homes and increased competition among sellers. Despite sales volumes exceeding 2024 levels, Rightmove has lowered its 2025 price rise forecast to 2% due to market dynamics.

news.title: Greater Noida: Over ₹4,000 crore dues from builders mired in legal dispute
news.para: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority is struggling to recover ₹4,081 crore from 21 major real estate projects due to ongoing legal battles. Supertech leads the defaulters with ₹903 crore dues, followed by Unitech at ₹828 crore. Many cases are pending in NCLT and High Court, hindering GNIDA's recovery efforts. The authority is seeking legal advice to resolve the impasses.

news.title: Enforcement directorate arrests two Ramprastha Group directors
news.para: Sandeep Yadav and Arvind Walia, promoters of Ramprastha Group, face arrest by the Enforcement Directorate. The arrest links to a money laundering investigation. Allegedly, a fraud of Rs 1,100 crore occurred with homebuyers. Raids took place in Delhi and Gurugram. The company is accused of diverting funds from housing projects. Homebuyers did not receive promised flats or plots.

news.title: Gujarat government waives ₹200 ownership certificate fee under SVAMITVA scheme
news.para: The Gujarat government has waived the Rs 200 fee for ownership certificates under the SVAMITVA scheme, benefiting rural property owners. This decision eliminates the cost for obtaining the "sanad" or ownership certificate. The state government will bear approximately Rs 50 crore to distribute around 25 lakh certificates across Gujarat, easing the financial burden.

news.title: UltraTech Cement posts profit of Rs 2,221 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: UltraTech Cement's consolidated net profit surged to ₹2,220.91 crore in Q1 FY26, driven by acquisitions and increased sales volumes reaching 36.83 million tonnes. Revenue from operations rose to ₹21,275.45 crore. The company benefited from lower energy costs and the successful turnaround of India Cements, which reported an EBITDA of ₹92 crore.

news.title: Lodha Developers raises ₹350 crore via private placement of NCDs
news.para: Lodha Developers has successfully raised ₹350 crore through a private placement of listed, secured, redeemable NCDs with a floating interest rate linked to MIBOR. The funds will enhance the company's funding profile and refinance existing liabilities. Additionally, the company recently secured ₹300 crore through NCDs with a fixed interest rate.

news.title: Subhash Ghai lease out commercial property in Mumbai for ₹3.38 lakh per month
news.para: Subash Ghai, Crest Ventures, and Mukta Arts have leased a 7,500 sq ft commercial property in Andheri West, Mumbai, for a starting monthly rent of ₹3.38 lakh. The five-year lease agreement includes a security deposit of ₹24.66 lakh, with rent escalating annually by approximately 5%, reaching ₹4.11 lakh in the final year.

news.title: Mysuru civic body submits proposal to upgrade as grade 1 city corporation
news.para: The Mysuru City Corporation (MCC) has proposed an upgrade to a grade 1 city corporation, similar to Hubballi-Dharwad, after the Greater Mysuru plan was shelved due to population constraints. This proposal involves merging surrounding municipal councils and town panchayats.

news.title: Slums gone, Chandigarh administration gets rolling with new urban blueprint
news.para: Chandigarh administration has reclaimed nearly 50 acres of government land. This land was previously occupied by slums and unauthorized structures. The administration demolished Sanjay Colony, Janta Colony and Adarsh Colony. The reclaimed land will be used for industrial plots, residential areas, and green belts.

news.title: NGT orders probe into ‘illegal’ sand mining in Dhenkanal
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has ordered a probe into alleged illegal sand mining in the Brahmani river in Dhenkanal district, following a petition by an NGO. The tribunal constituted a committee to investigate violations of environmental norms, including exceeding extraction limits and operating without proper clearances. The committee must submit a report within three weeks.
